title: Polynomials with real coefficients - misc additions

blocks.name: plymul02
blocks.content: Product of a polynomial with the zero polynomial. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 26-Sep-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm plymul02(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wceq(co(c0p, cof(cmul), c0), c0p))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(co(c0p, cof(cmul), c0), c0p, cmpt(hs0, cc, co(nat0, cmul, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), cmpt(hs0, cc, nat0), wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  mpteq2dva(hs0, cc, co(nat0, cmul, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), nat0, wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  mul02d(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cc)))
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), cc, c0, cc, wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  offval(hs0, c0p, cmul, c0, cc, nat0, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cc, cc, universe, universe, wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  mp1i(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wfn(c0p, cc), wf(c0p, cc, csn(nat0)))
  mpbir(wf(c0p, cc, csn(nat0)), wf(cxp(cc, csn(nat0)), cc, csn(nat0)))
  fconst(cc, nat0)
  c0ex()
  feq1i(c0p, cc, csn(nat0), cxp(cc, csn(nat0)))
  ffn(c0p, cc, csn(nat0))
  ffnd(c0, cc, cc, wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  plyf(c0, c1)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wcel(cc, universe))
  cnex()
  inidm(cc)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(cfv(c0p, cv(hs0)), nat0))
  0pval(cv(hs0))
  eqidd(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cc)))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)), wceq(c0p, cmpt(hs0, cc, nat0)))
  eqtri(c0p, cmpt(hs0, cc, nat0), cxp(cc, csn(nat0)))
  df-0p()
  fconstmpt(hs0, cc, nat0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(cply, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0p)
  diff.hs0.c(cmul)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
}

blocks.name: signsply0
blocks.content: Lemma for the rule of signs, based on Bolzano's intermediate value theorem for polynomials : If the lowest and highest coefficient ` A ` and ` B ` are of opposite signs, the polynomial admits a positive root. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 19-Sep-2018.)
